text:
To start this lab, you‚Äôll need:

SQL: MySQL, MySQL Workbench and a database called db_ecommerce
Python: Anaconda, Visual Studio Code and Visual Studio Code Extensions
Working environment: A folder on your machine called lab-competitive and an environment file with your MySQL password

Create Database

title: Resources
text:
Working environment

Folder
Create a new folder called lab-competitive


Environment file
You need to use an env file to store environment variables () file with your MySQL database password to access MySQL.
env file to store environment variables. This file contains key-value pairs in the format KEY=VALUE , with each variable on a new line. We can use libraries like python-dotenv to load the variables from the file into our Python script automatically.

MacOS

Download the env file in your Downloads folder (the file is hidden)
Open Finder and navigate to the Downloads folder
Move the file in your folder lab-competitive.
Open the file and replace YOUR-PASSWORD with your MySQL password.
Save the changes.
Rename the file from env to .env (this will hide the file)
To view hidden files, you need to press the ‚ÄúCommand‚Äù + ‚ÄúShift‚Äù + ‚Äú.‚Äù (period) keys at the same time. The hidden files will show up as translucent in the folder.
If you want to obscure the files again, press the same ‚ÄúCommand‚Äù + ‚ÄúShift‚Äù + ‚Äú.‚Äù (period) combination.



Windows 10

Download the env file in your Downloads folder (the file is hidden)
Open File Explorer from the taskbar.
Move the file in your folder lab-competitive.
Open the file and replace YOUR-PASSWORD with your MySQL password.
Save the changes.
Rename the file from env to .env (this will hide the file)
To view the hidden file: Select View > Options > Change folder and search options.
Select the View tab and, in Advanced settings, select Show hidden files, folders, and drives and OK.



Windows 11

Download the env file in your Downloads folder (the file is hidden)
Open File Explorer from the taskbar.
Move the file in your folder lab-competitive.
Open the file and replace YOUR-PASSWORD with your MySQL password.
Save the changes.
Rename the file from env to .env (this will hide the file)
To view the hidden file: Select View > Show > Hidden items.

title: Notebook
text:
Load Python libaries and API keys.

import os
import openai
import pandas as pd
import altair as alt
from dotenv import load_dotenv, find_dotenv


_ = load_dotenv(find_dotenv()) # read local .env file
openai.api_key  = os.environ['OPENAI_API_KEY']
